item.title: Hackney Council housing manager Denise Corbyn not informing residents on the Trowbridge estate of work being carried out causing disturbance inconvenience to other residents. Housing officer Denise Corbin walks around dressed inappropriate for the job like a fashion model. Housing officer Not wearing ID/displaying card to prove who she is. Housing officer Denise corbin is in the wrong job. Denise Corbin housing officer should not be a housing manager very incompetent. Solar panel engineers parking vehicles illegally causing obstruction because the housing officer has not gave subcontractor work parking permits. Housing officer Denise Corbin told subcontractor to park in residential parking spaces. Housing officer Denise Corbin is a bad project manager for this job. Site supervision needed. It's not a lot to ask for the housing officer Denise Corbin to inform residents of work being carried out., 14th January
item.description:
Housing officer not informing resident/lease holders of work schedule being carried out. Causing disturbance/inconvenient to people's work schedules because of noise.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hillman Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: To the rear of 5 - 7 Collection Place, in front of Bramshurst & Exonbury., 14th January
item.description:
There is a mature Ash - Narrow-leafed tree located at the rear of Collection Place; which we have been alerted to as it is touching the houses. Its canopy hangs close to the building (see photo), which could be damaged by windstorm, including if the tree falls. I can see via Camden Council website that there are outstanding works for this tree. Could these works be carried out as a matter of urgency to minimize the risk of it damaging the neighboring houses and property.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bolton Road, Maida Vale, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree o/s no 24 - has a notice on it to remove, 14th January
item.description:
Resident reporting the tree o/s her property has a notice from the Council to remove it, please could someone look into this asap please because it is only boarded up by 1 cone and 2 yellow barriers, however in the wind they are just being blown about and in front of the residents drive and hitting her car. Resident is also waiting for her front brick wall to be taken down to make more room but the builders can not get this job done because the pavement is raised an d tree removed. Resident is disabled and finding it difficult to keep picking up the barriers, other pedestrians with buggies move the barriers because they cant get by.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tenby Road, West Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: DANGEROUS HAZARD - Lime Bikes strewn across the footpath, 14th January
item.description:
Unwelcome Street Hazard & Street Clutter Clear & present danger - trip hazard, collision hazard, street clutter - Lime bikes strewn across the footpath in Bardsley Lane, Greenwich without any consideration for pedestrians, able bodies or frail and disabled, or road vehicle traffic. This behaviour is "repugnantly anti-social" (extremely offensive and harmful to others, showing a complete disregard for social norms and the well-being of individuals in a community) Action requested - please a) remove, and, b) create a geo-fence exclusion zone for this area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Bardsley Lane, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
